content_1: Romania. Romania’s National Sanitary Veterinary and Food Safety Authority has declared that the avian influenza outbreak that began in November is over. Poultry in the index village of Murighiol, and the entire area of Tulcea County, were inspected for infection. Because the village is in the Danube delta, the Veterinary Authority also tested the wild bird population. A total of 2,700 blood and tracheal samples were found negative. UK. A fourth swan has tested positive for H5N1. The bird was one of four found dead at the swannery in Abbotsbury on January 11. The others have tested negative. The Department for Environment Food and Rural Affairs said that there was no evidence at the present time of a widespread outbreak in the wild birds.
